description: Ancient ruins located in the upper section of Upper Yard on Skypiea. This is where Ohm conducts his Ordeal of Iron, one of the four deadly trials. The ruins are part of the ancient city of Shandora.

keyEvents.title: Confrontation at the Upper Ruins
keyEvents.description: Ohm confronts Zoro, Gan Fall, and Wyper at the Upper Ruins, initiating the deadly Ordeal of Iron.
keyEvents.significance: The Upper Ruins serve as the battlefield for one of the most dangerous confrontations in the Skypiea arc.

keyEvents.title: Nola Swallows Multiple Characters
keyEvents.description: The giant python Nola rises up near the Upper Ruins and swallows Nami, Gan Fall, Aisa, and Pierre.
keyEvents.significance: The Upper Ruins become the site of a dramatic turning point as multiple characters are removed from the battle.

keyEvents.title: Ohm Defeats Zoro and Wyper
keyEvents.description: Ohm uses his Iron Cloud sword to knock out both Zoro and Wyper at the Upper Ruins.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates the deadly nature of the Ordeal of Iron and why it has a 0% survival rate.

statusHistory.reason: Location remains accessible during the Skypiea arc

name.japanese: ジャイアントジャック付近

description: The area surrounding Giant Jack, a massive beanstalk that towers through the center of Upper Yard, piercing through the ruins of the ancient city of Shandora. This natural wonder serves as a central landmark of Skypiea.

keyEvents.title: Nola Appears Near Giant Jack
keyEvents.description: The giant python Nola rises up from the Giant Jack area to swallow multiple characters.
keyEvents.significance: Giant Jack area serves as hunting grounds for the massive snake Nola.

statusHistory.reason: Giant Jack remains standing during this episode

description: The interior of the massive 419-year-old python Nola. Her stomach is large enough to contain multiple humans and even buildings that she has swallowed over the centuries. The environment is dark and dangerous with toxic digestive fluids.

keyEvents.title: Luffy Trapped Inside
keyEvents.description: Luffy is shown struggling inside Nola, which he perceives as a cave.
keyEvents.significance: Sets up the reunion of multiple Straw Hats and allies inside Nola's stomach.

keyEvents.title: New Characters Swallowed
keyEvents.description: Nami, Gan Fall, Aisa, and Pierre are swallowed and enter this location.
keyEvents.significance: Adds more characters to the dangerous interior of Nola, setting up their eventual escape together.

statusHistory.reason: Location exists as long as Nola is alive

description: The designated meeting point where the Straw Hats planned to reunite after exploring Upper Yard. This location is where Pagaya and Conis bring the Going Merry to wait for the crew's return.

keyEvents.title: Going Merry Delivered to Meeting Point
keyEvents.description: Pagaya and Conis successfully deliver the Going Merry to the designated meeting point.
keyEvents.significance: Ensures the Straw Hats have a means of escape ready when they complete their mission on Upper Yard.

statusHistory.reason: Location serves as the rendezvous point for the Straw Hats

description: Enel's headquarters located atop an island cloud. From here, the self-proclaimed God of Skypiea observes all events on Upper Yard using his advanced Mantra (Observation Haki). Giant Jack passes through the shrine.

keyEvents.title: Enel Observes from God's Shrine
keyEvents.description: Enel uses his Mantra to monitor all the battles and events occurring at the Upper Ruins from his shrine.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates Enel's omniscient surveillance and control over Upper Yard.

statusHistory.reason: Enel's base of operations during the Skypiea arc
